flawed_nl_solution:
Start by finding how many fish were in the aquarium on the third day 6 * 2 * 2 = <<6*2*2=24>>24.
On day three, Jason took out one-third of the fish 24 / 3 = <<24/3=8>>8.
So at the end of day three, he has 24 - 8 = <<24-8=13>>13 fish.
On day five he has 13 * 2 * 2 = 52 fish, but he takes out one-fourth.
So he took out 52 / 4 = <<52/4=13>>13 fishes.
So at the end of day five, he has 52 - 13 = <<52-13=39>>39 fish.
On day seven he has 39 * 2 * 2 = <<39*2*2=156>>156 fish.
He adds in 15 more, so he has 156 + 15 = <<156+15=171>>171 fish in total.
#### 171

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 16, not 13. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
